trans-unit.source: Exception class to indicate that the [!INCLUDE[infocard](~/add/includes/infocard-md.md)] service is busy processing other requests.
A ServiceBusyException exception is thrown to indicate that the CardSpace service is busy processing other requests.
CardSpace does not queue requests, and can service only one request at a time.
Determine whether another instance of CardSpace is running.
If there is another instance running, end it by stopping the icardagt.exe process from Task Manager.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.ServiceBusyException"></xref> class.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.ServiceBusyException"></xref> class with the specified error message.
This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error.
The content of the message should also be understandable to the user.
The message that describes the error.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.ServiceBusyException"></xref> class with serialization information and streaming context specified.
This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object that holds the serialized object data about the exception that is being thrown.
The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext> object that contains contextual information about the source or destination.

Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.ServiceBusyException"></xref> class with the specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The message that describes the error.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.
